content.raw: @{557058:67759e29-d1df-465f-868d-047738e36fc9} does this seem related to previous issues with the tinyxml2 target and DART?
content.html: @Michael Grey does this seem related to previous issues with the tinyxml2 target and DART?

content.raw:
I believe [this line](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/2b59492f96fcf121b33f290fd5cf0b70b42f4e22/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#lines-242) is the culprit. After that line is run, it will store `tinyxml2_FOUND` permanently in the cmake cache. That's a problem because DART wants to create a target called `tinyxml2::tinyxml2`, but DART will skip that step if it believes that tinyxml2 was already found and handled.

This can be fixed in Gazebo by tweaking those two lines to:

```
    pkg_check_modules(gazebo-tinyxml2 tinyxml2)
    if (NOT gazebo-tinyxml2_FOUND)
```

@{557058:434ecab2-e510-4ede-8f9a-1c2a5a4032e1} I recommend making that change in your local copy of the gazebo-9 source code to see if it helps.

Ah, I see, there are more places where the `tinyxml2` prefix needs to be changed to `gztinyxml2`. Basically every instance of `tinyxml2_` throughout the Gazebo cmake should be changed to `gztinyxml2_`.

At a minimum that would include `tinyxml2_LIBRARIES` → `gztinyxml2_LIBRARIES` and `tinyxml2_INCLUDE_DIRS` → `gztinyxml_INCLUDE_DIRS`. Here’s what I find from doing a recursive grep:

content.raw:
My best guess at the moment is that something else somewhere is caching the result of `tinyxml2_FOUND` to `TRUE`.

Could you find where the `CMakeCache.txt` is located for your Gazebo build and then run:

```
cat CMakeCache.txt | grep tinyxml2
```

Looking at the values of those variables in the cache should help to confirm \(or debunk\) my hypothesis.

Looking at the values of those variables in the cache should help to confirm (or debunk) my hypothesis.

content.raw:
holy smokes I fixed it… In CMakeCache.txt I went to the line “TINYXML2\_INCLUDE\_DIRS:INTERNAL=” and I changed it to: “TINYXML2\_INCLUDE\_DIRS:INTERNAL=/usr/include”

I got tipped this may be an issue by going into DARTFindtinyxml2.cmake and removing the quiet flag… I then realized it couldn’t find the header file….
content.html:
holy smokes I fixed it… In CMakeCache.txt I went to the line “TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS:INTERNAL=” and I changed it to: “TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS:INTERNAL=/usr/include”

I got tipped this may be an issue by going into DARTFindtinyxml2.cmake and removing the quiet flag… I then realized it couldn’t find the header file….

content.raw:
Thanks for that insight! That gives me one more hypothesis about what could cause this.

@{557058:434ecab2-e510-4ede-8f9a-1c2a5a4032e1} , could you try changing [this block](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/blob/e480e2f06bd8c0dbd0be6862b7e5b4cb01df6cdf/cmake/Findtinyxml2.cmake#L26-L29) to the following:

```
find_path(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS
    NAMES tinyxml2.h
    HINTS ${PC_TINYXML2_INCLUDEDIR}
    PATHS
      "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}/include"
      "/usr/include")
```

In theory the `find_path()` function should automatically search in `/usr/include` in step 5 [mentioned here](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/command/find_path.html), but maybe the `CMAKE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE_PATH` variable is not getting set correctly?

content.raw:
Got it! It’s ignition-cmake0 in combination with DART who’s making mess… Here’s what’s going on:

1. First CMake run: DART calls `find_path(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS ...)` from its own Findtinyxml2.cmake . This puts the variable TINYXML2\_INCLUDE\_DIRS into CMake cache.
2. First CMake run: Ignition CMake calls `pkg_check_modules(TINYXML2 tinyxml2)` \(it gets called by ign-common and ign-fuel-tools\). This \(even if it finds the package\) sets `TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS` to an empty string. This was “fixed” in [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/commits/e8913dfc6e0ae0c8e510f51d571335a90755e0c0](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/commits/e8913dfc6e0ae0c8e510f51d571335a90755e0c0) , however this commit did not make it \(yet\) into ignition-common0.
3. Second CMake run: `find_path(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS ...)` in DART doesn’t look up the path again, because it’s in cache. However, the cache contains an empty string. 
4. Second CMake run: FindPackageHandleStandardArgs at the end of Findtinxyxml2.cmake from DART considers the tinyxml2 package as not found because of the empty path.
5. From now on, the CMake phase is broken.

So the solution is to unset `TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS` from cache on specific places. Or, an even better solution would be if [the fix from newer versions of ignition-common would be backported to ignition-common0](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/issues/67/ignition-cmake0-unset-blank-cache).

There’s not even need for renaming all the Gazebo usages of tinyxml2 to gztinyxml2 \(though it would be a good idea anyways\).

So the fastest fix is:

```diff
diff -r fc44c9cb4072 cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
--- a/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake        Thu Oct 10 11:23:15 2019 +0200
+++ b/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake        Fri Oct 11 17:28:25 2019 +0200
@@ -161,6 +161,7 @@
 
   #################################################
   # Find DART
+  unset(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS CACHE)
   set(DART_MIN_REQUIRED_VERSION 6)
   find_package(DART ${DART_MIN_REQUIRED_VERSION} CONFIG OPTIONAL_COMPONENTS utils-urdf)
   if (DART_FOUND)
@@ -174,6 +175,7 @@
     BUILD_WARNING ("DART ${DART_MIN_REQUIRED_VERSION} not found, for dart physics engine option, please install libdart${DART_MIN_REQUIRED_VERSION}-dev.")
     set (HAVE_DART FALSE)
   endif()
+  unset(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS CACHE)
 
   #################################################
   # Find tinyxml. Only debian distributions package tinyxml with a pkg-config
@@ -738,6 +740,7 @@
 
 ################################################################################
 # Find the Ignition Fuel Tools library
+unset(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS CACHE)
 find_package(ignition-fuel_tools1 1.2 QUIET)
 if (NOT ignition-fuel_tools1_FOUND)
   message (STATUS "Looking for libignition-fuel_tools1 - not found")
@@ -764,6 +767,7 @@
     link_directories(${ignition-common1_LIBRARY_DIRS})
   endif()
 endif()
+unset(TINYXML2_INCLUDE_DIRS CACHE)
```

Should I post a PR with these changes or would you like to find a better fix for this issue \(or wait for the ignition-common backport\)?

‌

content.raw: @{557058:67759e29-d1df-465f-868d-047738e36fc9} What helped me a lot during the debugging was CMake’s [variable\_watch](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/variable_watch.html) . I haven’t known it before but found it somewhere on SO. I love this feature \(though it’s not working in 100% cases - e.g. the pkg\_check\_modules cache alteration was not captured\).
